ENTRY.refkeywords: delchi chi square squared plot plotting
ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Plot the delchi residuals of the fit: (data-model)/error

DESC.PARA: The plot_delchi command plots the sigma residuals of the fit, defined to be (data-model) / error The plot_resid() command will plot (data - model)

ROW.DATA: the id of the dataset to plot
should previously-calculated arrays be used to create the plot?

If True
then add the data to the current plot, otherwise erase the frame and create a new plot.

DESC.PARA: The plot is displayed in a ChIPS plotting window. If there is no plotting window open, one is created. If a plotting window exists, the overplot parameter value determines whether the new plot is overlaid on any existing plots in the window or if the window is cleared before the plot is drawn.
ChIPS commands may be used within Sherpa to modify plot characteristics and create hardcopies; refer to the ChIPS website for information.
To plot multiple Sherpa objects - e.g. data, model, fit, residuals - in a single window, use the plot command.
Plot the delchi residuals for the default dataset.
Plot the delchi residuals of the fit for the "src" dataset, overlaying on any existing plots.
